definition: locked in a stalemate/to confront one another
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition

sentences.english: The natives have been warring over this small piece of land without either side winning.
sentences.chinese: 土人一直在爭奪這一小片土地，雙方相持不下。

sentences.english: War dozen the decade be stalemated, both parties all loss miserably heavy.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭打了十年相持不下，雙方都損失慘重。

sentences.english: At present, the Republicans are a result of domestic policy issues with Barack Obama at loggerheads.
sentences.chinese: 當前，共和黨人正與奧巴馬因國內政策問題相持不下。

sentences.english: The war was at a stalemate.
Lucy: If you're ever in an argument, you can always trump with a dead mother.
sentences.chinese: 如果相持不下就使出你死老媽子的絕招。

sentences.english: Brazil coach see the ground situation in stalemate, to suspend the application of technology.
sentences.chinese: 巴西隊教練看到場上局面相持不下，申請了技術暫停。

sentences.english: Right now we are at the loggerheads stage.
sentences.chinese: 目前正處於相持不下的階段。

sentences.english: The two companies have locked horns over other issues in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾年，這兩家公司因其他問題而相持不下。

sentences.english: Since we need the goods urgently. we must insist on express shipment.
sentences.chinese: 由於我方急需這批貨物，我方相持操縱快遞裝運。

sentences.english: The employers and strikers had deadlocked over the wage.
sentences.chinese: 僱主和罷工者在工資問題上相持不下。

sentences.english: The employers and strikers had deadlocked over the wage .
sentences.chinese: 僱主和罷工者在工資問題上相持不下。

sentences.english: And the stage of strategic stalemate is the stage of preparation for our counter-offensive.
sentences.chinese: 這種戰略相持階段，即是準備反攻階段。

sentences.english: After the taking of La Haie-Sainte the battle wavered.
sentences.chinese: 在奪取了聖拉埃以後，戰事形成了相持不下的局面。

sentences.english: Stalemate segment capacity is relatively poor, are lethal backhand is not strong.
sentences.chinese: 相持段能力比較差，正反手的殺傷力不強。

definition: at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
